intro: Monopsis alba, commonly known as the white monopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Monopsis alba thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
